intro: Pteroneurum dalmaticum, commonly known as the Dalmatian spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
